metadata.title: Pharmacologic Modulation of ACE2 Expression Corresponding author

abstract.original_text: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzymatically active homologue of angiotensin-converting enzyme that degrades angiotensin I, angiotensin II, and other peptides. Recent studies have shown that under pathologic conditions, ACE2 expression in the kidney is altered. In this review, we briefl y summarize recent studies dealing with pharmacologic interventions that modulate ACE2 expression. ACE2 amplifi cation may have a potential therapeutic role for kidney disease and hypertension.
